meanings.definition: A high-pitched cry made by a cat.
meanings.sent1: The kitten let out a soft mew when it wanted attention.
meanings.sent2: I heard the mew of a cat outside my window last night.
meanings.sent3: The mew of the cat was so cute, it made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her mew was like a tiny bell ringing in the quiet room.
meanings.sent5: The mew of the lost kitten echoed through the alley, tugging at my heart.

meanings.definition: A cage or enclosed area for birds of prey.
meanings.sent1: The falcon rested in its mew after a successful hunt.
meanings.sent2: The mew was designed to keep the birds safe and comfortable.
meanings.sent3: The mew was so spacious that the eagle could spread its wings fully.
meanings.sent4: The mew stood tall and strong, a fortress for the majestic birds.
meanings.sent5: The mew overlooked the valley, offering a perfect view for the falcons.

meanings.definition: To make a high-pitched cry like a cat.
meanings.sent1: The kitten will mew when it's hungry.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the cat mew softly in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The baby tried to mew like a cat, causing everyone to laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her voice mewed in the night, a haunting sound in the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The wind made the branches mew, creating an eerie atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To confine or shut up in a cage or enclosed space.
meanings.sent1: We had to mew the injured bird for its own safety.
meanings.sent2: The zookeepers needed to mew the tiger during feeding time.
meanings.sent3: The magician pretended to mew himself in a box for the trick.
meanings.sent4: The walls seemed to mew around him, closing in on all sides.
meanings.sent5: She felt like the world was trying to mew her in, suffocating her freedom.
